org.xflatdb.xflat.db

Class IdGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.db.IdGenerator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigIntIdGenerator, TimestampIdGenerator, UuidIdGenerator

    public abstract class IdGenerator
extends Object
    The base class for an ID generator. ID generators are selected on a per-table basis by the Database based on an ID generation strategy. The strategy selects the first IdGenerator in the strategy that supports the ID property's type. The strategy can be overridden by a custom TableConfig. All IdGenerator implementations MUST have a no-args constructor so that they can be constructed by reflection when necessary.
    Author:
    gordon

        public IdGenerator()

    • Method Detail

      • supports

        public abstract boolean supports(Class<?> idType)
        Indicates whether the given ID property type is supported by this ID generator. If false, then IDs generated by this generator cannot be assigned to the ID property of the POJO, and thus the POJO cannot be stored in this Table.
        Parameters:
        idType - The type of the ID property on the POJO.
        Returns:
        true if the type is supported by the ID generator.

      • generateNewId

        public abstract Object generateNewId(Class<?> idType)
        Generates a new ID, converting it to the given id type.
        Parameters:
        idType - The type to convert the ID to, must be one of the supported types as given by supports(java.lang.Class)
        Returns:
        The converted ID value.

      • idToString

        public abstract String idToString(Object id)
        A convenience for converting IDs to their string representations. Since all engines take string IDs (which can be stored in the XML DOM) this is how we persist the ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID to convert, cannot be null.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the given ID, or null if it could not be converted.

      • stringToId

        public abstract Object stringToId(String id,
                Class<?> idType)
        A convenience for converting IDs from their string representations. Since all engines take string IDs (which can be stored in the XML DOM) this is how we get a persisted ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The string value of the ID.
        idType - The type to convert the ID to, must be one of the supported types as given by supports(java.lang.Class).
        Returns:
        The converted ID, or null if it could not be converted.

      • saveState

        public void saveState(org.jdom2.Element state)
        Saves this ID generator's state to a JDOM Element so it can save when its associated Engine spins down. When saving state the IdGenerator is guaranteed to have no invocations on generateNewId(java.lang.Class<?>). Stateless ID generators such as the UuidIdGenerator do not have to override this.
        Parameters:
        state - The table metadata element to which the IdGenerator should save any state info.

      • loadState

        public void loadState(org.jdom2.Element state)
        Loads this ID generator's state from a JDOM element so it can resume when its associated engine spins up. When loading state the IdGenerator is guaranteed to have no invocations on generateNewId(java.lang.Class<?>). Stateless ID generators such as the UuidIdGenerator do not have to override this.
        Parameters:
        state - The table metadata element from which the IdGenerator should load any state info.
